answers.answer: I am not diabetic, my friends wife was and she/baby was fine. I think they just categorize you as high risk and will watch you closer.

Your insulin needs will likely change as baby grows. You will likely have to test your blood sugar more frequently to make sure your sugars are staying well controlled. Many mothers with diabetes have perfectly healthy babies. Your doctor will be able to give you more information but basically what you need to do right now is take a deep breath. Stress isn't good for your body or the baby you're growing. Continue a healthy diet and drink plenty of water and get your rest. And your doctor will help you going forward from there.

You will be fine. My friend is and she is pregnant with twins. You just have more appointments and more ultrasounds to make sure everything is going good. Don't freak out, stress is not good for the baby.

As long as you eat healthy and watch your weight gain you will be fine. The most common issue for diabetics is large babies, due to the amount of sugar they receive.  Don't worry yourself anymore than necessary as that usually causes a rise in blood sugar as well. You will most likely be considered high risk, but I would try to relax.

I am diabetic n just over 17wks. I am high risk and monitored closer. I was seeing my ob weekly while adjusting my diabetes meds (not insulin dependent yet, but may be later in pregnancy) I have just gone to every other week visits. I have had four scans to make sure baby is ok. I will start seeing a fetal specialist at 20 weeks.  I was told to be prepared for a c-section if baby is too large but for now planning a natural delivery.  My best advice  is try not to stress, check ur sugars often (especially if ur not feeling right) keep a good log to show your Dr. Trust your Dr work on a plan with him/her to control your sugars but don't freak if they get outta whack. Exercise daily dont over do it tho. Good luck...

Thank you ladies...what I forgot to put is I am on the pill not insulin yet.I have been taking my medica because I wasn't sure if it was safe.But I will be sure to tell my doctor all pf what I have been up to..So I read one of u said I might have to have a c-section had one with my first child and when I was born I was cut down there because I had a hernia so with all of those cutsWill it still be safe to have a nother ?

question: I will make this one short this time...(my second time asking this question)I am 9 and a half weeks pregnant and I am a diabetic.This is my second child was a diabetic with my frist child SO I AM SCARED NOT SURE WHAT IS GOING TO HAPPEN.Will my baby be okay?What are the risk?Have anyone else is going thou or has been thou this?What happen?I pray all the time I just have to make sure my baby is okay.I have a doctor appointmemt next week but I need to know now..HELP ME PLEASE
title: THIS IS important NEED HELP!!!HELP ME!
